questions.question: Why is a V-notch considered more sensitive at low flow rates compared to other notches?

answers.b: The flow area increases rapidly with head
answers.c: It reduces the velocity of flow

explanations.a: Incorrect – a larger opening doesn't guarantee better sensitivity.
explanations.b: Correct – the V-notch's triangular shape causes a rapid increase in flow area as head increases. Learn more
explanations.c: Incorrect – the V-notch does not primarily function by reducing velocity.
explanations.d: Incorrect – manufacturing ease isn't related to flow sensitivity.

questions.question: What does the angle θ represent in the V-notch discharge formula?

explanations.a: Incorrect – θ is not the width.
explanations.b: Incorrect – it has nothing to do with surface slope.
explanations.c: Correct – θ is the angle of the V-notch opening. Reference
explanations.d: Incorrect – height is represented by H.

questions.question: What happens to the flow rate if the head over a 90° V-notch doubles?

explanations.a: Incorrect – flow rate increases nonlinearly with head.
explanations.b: Incorrect – it increases more than triple.
explanations.c: Correct – because Q ∝ H^(5/2), doubling H increases Q by more than double. Proof here
explanations.d: Incorrect – flow rate definitely changes with head.

questions.question: Which property of water directly affects the theoretical discharge through a V-notch?

explanations.a: Partially relevant but not direct in the formula.
explanations.b: Not included in standard discharge calculations.
explanations.c: Correct – density influences flow due to its role in gravitational potential energy. Reference

questions.question: What happens to the coefficient of discharge (Cd) if energy losses around the V-notch increase?

explanations.b: Correct – more losses mean actual discharge is less, lowering Cd. Explore more
explanations.c: Incorrect – it won’t drop to zero unless there's no flow.
explanations.d: Incorrect – Cd changes with flow conditions.
